revised_title: An Account of the Plague in Constantinople: Symptoms, Transmission, and Historical Context
tldr: This article describes the author's observations and experiences with the plague in Constantinople, focusing on its symptoms, transmission, and historical context. The author discusses the role of infection through contact and the spread of the disease through the Levant region. They also touch upon the role of environmental factors, such as murrain among black cattle and swarms of butterflies, in the occurrence of plagues. The author emphasizes the importance of understanding the plague's nature and transmission to prevent its spread and protect public health.
